definition[0]: to make a person or a group of people or things go from one place to various other places
example[0]: Information was sent out to interested students.
example[1]: Search parties were sent out to look for survivors.
definition[1]: to broadcast or produce a signal, light, sound etc
example[2]: The ship is sending out an SOS signal.
definition[2]: to ask a restaurant or food shop to deliver food to you at home or at work
definition[3]: to send things from a central place to various other places
example[4]: The bank will be sending out details to all its customers.
example[5]: Once your business cards are printed, start sending them out as soon as possible.
